content:
12, 2016
												7 years after this game was released - is it still worth playing?The answer is a resounding... YES!There are some experiences in life that can tell you more about yourself. L4D2 has been one of those experiences.From the outside, this is just a zombie game (BRAAAAIINSSS!) with hilarious characters and overpowered weapons.But it is so much more. It teaches you the value of sticking together as a team, of putting others ahead of yourself, of facing your fears, efficiently using your available resources and pacing yourself to the finish.It invites you to become a more skilled shooter, a more patient gamer and empathize with your teammates for your own good.Timing is another key to victory - whether that be the timing of your attacks as an infected or the timing of your m2 against one.A note about the online L4D2 community:Yes, there are lots of people who take this game very seriously and hate losing/ love winning. As a new player, if you end up playing with some of these people, you are likely to get kicked out of the server. This is unfortunate, but it's true.To these 'pros', I say that sometimes it is wise to put yourself in the shoes of the new players - after all, we were all noobs once. You might win a game by kicking someone, but if you decide to teach them instead, you might help the community gain a new capable player for many more fun games.That said, I've met many wonderful people in this community. Almost all my Steam friends have come from L4D2, and for good reason.TL;DR:In this game, you will dread some moments, you will laugh out loud, you will feel accomplished in victory and disappointment in defeat. This is a ride that never ends.*THE BEST $5 I HAVE EVER SPENT FOR MYSELF AND PROBABLY EVER WILL. EVEN THOUGH THE GAME IS QUITE OLD, IF YOU'RE THINKING ABOUT TRYING IT OUT, STOP THINKING AND GET IT. NOW.BUYER BEWARE, HOWEVER: IT MAY TAKE OVER YOUR LIFE.*

content:
ber 16, 2014
												Left 4 Dead 2 forces you to work as a team (if you want to win). You need to talk, and you need to participate. Every member of your four person squad of Survivors needs to be communicating about what they're doing, calling out locations for ammunition, weapon, and health pickups, and asking for help when in trouble. The catch is that no stage ever plays out the same way, because there's an artificial intelligence called the Director governing the action. Packs of common zombies can attack at any time, and if what the Director throws at you proves too challenging, your path of progression through a stage may even get swapped around to make things easier. It makes every experience different, and encourages repeat play as it adapts to challenge players of any skill level. The only reason I see for anyone NOT to purchase the game is if you don't like playing online. However, if you don't mind being social and have gaming friends, then you have no excuse.

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 7, 2014
												This is a game that has done nothing but improve from its predecessor as a sequel in almost every way. The new weapons and game modes are astonishing. There is literally no purpose in going back to the first game, as nearly everything that was there is present here in a better way, with many additions. However while the game is superior, it is still not one that makes me want to come back a lot on my own. It's a game that I recommend one to get only if he/she has friends to play it with, as that is how you'll enjoy the game to the max. Single player will get dull and repetitive after a while, and even multiplayer can be monotonous. The teammate A.I. still hasn't improved, often times they'll just stand there while you're being smashed by a charger or getting cut by a hunter. Despite this, if you get on this game with the sole desire of slaying zombies with your friends, or killing your friends as zombies or survivors on the entertaining versus mode, it can be very fun. Great job, Valve. 7.5/10.0

content:
er 8, 2010
												Left 4 dead 2 is one of the most interactive co-op game I've ever played. This game will appeal to others who are looking for competitive, fun, and intense gameplay. Feel the wrath of hundred and hundred of zombies launching themselves at your throats. Don't stop for one sec for a Smoker to bind you with it's tongue. Don't stay in a open spot for a Hunter to claw you to death. Don't seperate from your teammates, you'll find yourself at the mercy of an Jockey. Zombies aren't your only enemies, watch your feet for acid that burns like no others from the mouth of an Spitter. Zombies are not noticing you? Then bathe in the bile of a Boomer to show a horde of zombies how good you looked......to eat. Narrow areas are the Charger's favorite spot to squash you into pancakes. She may be crying, but once the Witch is startled, you're in for a world of hurt, hope you have health insurance. Rarely appears, the Tank is the boss of zombies. He's one badass that will put your lights out.

												Este juego no es como la paja, que al menos divierte jugar solo. Está pensado para jugar con amigos/amigos de amigos o randoms si es que te gusta tratar con completos desconocidos. El tema es que, como todo juego MP de Valve, la community en general es un asco, llena de parásitos que se creen "pr0", cuando la realidad es que tienen 5000 horas porque son pobres y un día se les dio la mágica la posibilidad de comprar este juego por, como mucho, 5U$s. Obviamente todo esto previo jugar otras 5000 horas en servers No-Steam, llena de comandos pelotudos y mensajes cuando entrás, seguramente algunos subliminales de corte peronista.El único modo que vale la pena, en mi opinión, es el versus (4vs4), donde está el plus de la competencia. El modo campaña es una ♥♥♥♥♥♥ que consiste en ir de un punto a otro para terminar en un auto/blindado/barco/avión/heli/armario. Y los otros dos están porque había que poner algo, uno es el genérico survival y el otro es simplemente una cagada que ni recuerdo como se llama.Es agradable si te encontrás un grupito de gente copada para jugarlo cada tanto, ya que usualmente te tienen que bancar por más que seas un reverendo hijo de ♥♥♥♥, debido a que casi siempre falta gente y no da jugar con un slot libre porque los bots son como simios con autismo y entonces se desbalancea todo.Si no encontrás al menos 7 entes vivientes o 3 si te gusta la ♥♥♥♥♥♥, recomiendo tener amor propio y jugar a otra cosa, y si sos pobre y no tenés otro juego jugá al TF2 que es F2P y volvete más mogólico pero con la posibilidad de tradear y dejar de serlo.

												This is one of those classic must own games on steam.The game premise revolves around being able to choose between four characters - and a certain gun set such as machine guns and shotguns. Multiple zombie hoards come attacking you wave after wave and can stop suddenly. Which sets this game apart from other zombie games is there is certain zombie types in this game. One guy as a tongue that stretches out and grabs people, another guy is a big fat blob who goes around puking on people and attracting zombies to them (and when he dies he blows up)! The game is set up as FPS with the player having the ability to heal themselves (while being not able to shoot) or heal their partner. The best game setting for me personally was the ability to play humans vs zombies where you take charge of one of the special zombie types.RATING :  7.65/10Gameplay B Story / Campaign B- Visuals / User Interface B- Sounds / Music B- Replay-ability B- Overall  B-

content:
4, 2015
												Left 4 Dead 2 is a game where four survivors attempt to survive and escape the zombie horde.If they survive or not, is up to you, and how you play.Left 4 Dead 2 manages to be fast-paced in a genre of slow zombie survivals, but it also still manages to retain the tense and stressful nature of the rest of the zombie games. There is no aim down sights in the game, unless you are using a sniper rifle, similar to the rest of Valve's games. Another thing in line with the rest of Valve's work is the lack of regenerating health. In Left 4 Dead 2, players must use first aid kits in order to heal themselves, with adrenaline shots and painkillers acting as 'temporary' health. Much of your survival depends on how well you utilize your first-aid...Do you save it in case something goes wrong, do you use it on someone else, or do you use it like it's the last chance you'll ever get...? Will you ever find more down the road? These are the questions you'll quickly ask yourself and the rest of your party as you try to make it through.Other than the healing items, there are various other items to keep an eye out for as well. Pipe bombs, molotovs, and even a jar of bile. Pipe bombs draw standard zombies to them with a loud beeping sound and a bright red light. In Left 4 Dead, loud sounds will attract zombies, and the pipe bomb in particular will keep them away from you, and will eventually kill them when it explodes. The molotov is a simple but effective weapon in keeping the horde away, it puts down a field of fire and it burns enemies. The last item is the bile jar. It attracts the horde to anything you throw it at, and they'll stay on it for a while, killing whatever it happens to land on. Even other zombies.The jar is filled with the insides of a boomer, one of the special infected of the game. The special infected of Left 4 Dead 2 are zombies with unique abilities that will prove deadly to survivors, and will require cooperation or a skilled shot to take down. Perhaps both..The Boomer is a large zombie that vomits on survivors. This attracts the horde of generic zombies to attack them. However, if the survivors are not careful in dispatching the boomer, it will explode on death and splatter on the survivors, turning a situation from bad to worse.The Hunter is a fast and agile zombie with a normal body frame, making it slightly harder to distinguish than other special infected when running. However, when it gets into a crouching position, it pounces on survivors and claws them until they die. It can pounce from very high locations to do extra damage, or it can ambush survivors from unexpected places. The Hunter wears a hoodie, and growls when getting ready to attack, screaming loudly when pouncing.The Smoker is a tall zombie that coughs a lot. That's why you don't smoke, because then you'll get lungs like this guy.Anyways, the smoker has long reach, allowing it to pull survivors around, and into dangerous positions. Smokers will try to pull you into a car alarm to draw the horde to you, or they will try to pull you to another special infected so they can try to pick off another survivor, or maybe they'll just pull a survivor off a ledge, either getting them stuck holding it for their life, or forcing the victim to run all the way back to their group.The Tank is a large, massive, and powerful zombie that can kill the entire group if left unchecked. They have huge muscles, which makes them an easy target, but it also represents their strength. One punch from a tank, and you'll fly several feet away from the rest of the survivors, and, on high difficulties, it could even end you in one hit. They can even toss rubble at the survivors, giving them a range option, as well as already being lethal in close quarters.The Jockey is a small zombie, he runs fairly quickly and jumps on survivors, 'riding' them away into danger.The Spitter is a taller type of special infected that spits acid onto survivors, being an effective long range unit that can deny an area to the survivors, or flush them out. Spitters also drop a pool of acid when they die, making them a bit more dangerous to deal with, especially when you are being pressured by a large amount of zombies.The Charger is a large zombie that literally charges survivors. They run at the survivors with full speed and once they pick up a target, they continue running for a while, or until they hit something. This makes them very dangerous in situations where they can thrust you off of a dangerous height, or if there's deep water, because they can sacrifice themselves and take you with them.Now, we've covered all of the special infected, and there's also uncommon infected as well, but I won't go over them here in order to save some space, and they aren't too important anyways.The gunplay in Left 4 Dead 2 is very easy to get used to. From assault rifles, shotguns, pistols, melee weapons, snipers, and even grenade launchers, players should find it simple to point and shoot at zombies. Headshots are obviously more rewarding, as it will kill them zombie faster, and you'll save some ammo too. There are different deployable ammo types as well, which have different properties. High explosive, for example, will explode!In Left 4 Dead 2, there are events in the game where you have to do something very loud in order to progress, but they draw a LOT of attention. These are called 'Crescendo Events'. These actions cause a massive attack from the infected, and require the survivors to defend themselves until the action is completed. Some events are gauntlet styled, which require survivors to run, rather than wait. Zombies will keep spawning in these gauntlet styled events, so it's best to move quickly. Also, at the jukebox, there's a song that plays and it says 'All we wanna do is eat your brains', which will also spawn enemies.When a survivor dies, you can rescue them in closets through the game, or revive them with a defibrillator. However, you can rescue them before that and revive them when they are down. Going down too often without using first aid will result in death, which can be noted when the screen turns grey. Some game modes disable spawning, so it may be suited for super serious players.At the end of every campaign, there is a final chapter, a finale.In the end, survivors hold out until rescue arrives, and this is the last stand for the campaign.Whoever dies here, is dead at the end, and at least one survivor must escape.Being prepared is extremely important here, as it will require determination from all survivors.Occasionally, the finale will also require the survivors run through another 'gauntlet' styled attack, except the finales are far more dangerous than the standard events, featuring more enemies and lots of special infected.I recommend getting the game for CO-OP, it's great at what it does, which is being a great CO-OP experience.For the single players, I honestly have trouble with recommending this game because there simply isn't enough to justify getting it just to play with the AI. The AI is extremely dumb, and they have HORRIBLE reaction times, occasionally letting you take massive amounts of damage before they save you, and not bothering to shoot the special infected, but instead they try to melee them when they are on you, making them waste valuable seconds needed to save your life. There's also not really a real story, other than backstories about the survivors and backstories about the other stuff around you. While some people have grown into the characters of L4D, I personally have not cared about any one of them enough to feel connected with the game itself. The soundtrack is also not really worth mentioning, in my opinion. It has a nice attempt at trying to place a dark feeling, but it's simply average at best. Gameplay also becomes monotonous without friends and workshop content, but you'll get a lot of replayability.

content:
er 27, 2013
												First of all: this game is the best Cooperative FPS game you will ever find anywhere. No doubt. But before you actually decide to buy it, you must ask yourself whether you are going to play with random players or a bunch of friends. Make sure to think it through and answer honestly, it's extremely important.Should you decide to play together with your friends: BUY IT! You won't be disappointed in the slightest. This game offers an action packed gameplay, where you try your best to survive the campaign, while tricky and malignant A.I. Director will own you big time.Spawning tank where you least expect it, spawning Jockey to ra*e you should you wander off alone etc. You will find yourself in desperate situations many times, being surrounded by a horde of zombies without ammo, when slightest error means death. You should especially aim for Expert (or Expert Realism) difficulty whenever you feel ready. This way you will go through the truest L4D2 experience. You need reflex, aiming skills, a will to survive and an abillity to make decisions in a fraction of second. But your friends will certainly be there for you. They will share their medications with you, provide a cover with firearm, watch your back or... put a bullet in your back. Friendly fire is certainly here, it's quite an art not to shoot anyone with people running in panic or just changing their position. Crouch a lot so others can shoot above your head and watch your fire. Friendly fire can be even more harmful than few hits from a common infected. If you are not a maniac who loves realism in video games and just look for action packed gameplay with cooperative apporach, there is NO better option than L4D2. Do not play with bots though, they obviously can't handle more than normal difficulty level.Should you decide to play without your friends and just join random players: DO NOT BUY IT!You will fall into despair after playing a round in let's say 80% of lobbies. There will be rookies playing on expert difficulty, people who's never heard of English language and simply can't communicate with you, griefers, people who join the game just to kill you all and then leave, people who waste medications just so you won't have them, those who will incapacitate you numerous time cuz "you shouldn't get hit, I was aiming above you", those who will nonchalantly run into your fireline getting incapacitated and telling you to watch your fire etc. VS mode? Ok but you need to understand one very important aspect of it. People will leave immediately when they think they are losing the match and I'm not even joking. You owned the whole opposing team right after start? Well you can be proud, but they will leave the game and the match will end unless someone from your team joins the other one. Best advice would be: show your skills of course but give your enemies at least an impression that they can still win should they try harder. Sounds surreal but you should keep that in mind unless you want your matches to end halfway through.TL;DR: 9.5/10 for the actual game. 0/10 for community. Do not play with randoms, play with your friends.

content:
8, 2014
												I would rate this game a 10/10, for it has no co-op zombie game superior.A fantastic game, even in this day and age years after it's original release. The game is strongly being kept alive by various active server communities as well as by the modders and mappers (of which I am one). The community as a whole is rather pass or fail though, in Pub (Public) games you will find all kinds of people, phenominally trolls, team killers, trash talkers, and bad sportsmen; these people alone are the main flaw in what is otherwise a fantastic zombie killing game. This game is easily modded and mapped for, server maintenance is easier than other games like garrysmod (for example) and when you do find friends or friendly people you will have a great time.The gore is 10/10 make sure to set it to HIGH for the full zombie killing effect, blast parts off of those zombies like no tomorrow.The sounds are 10/10, game is well made and the sounds are very definitive, you can use them to identify an infected and where they are.The environments are 10/10, they simply are aesthetically pleasing without being overwhelming.The stock (vanilla) maps (world levels) are numerous and diverse, anything from hospitals to sewers to shopping malls and national forests.The gamemodes are great 10/10:Survival (survive on a clock in a map and go for the gold in increasingly difficult hordes)Mutation (play gamemodes that change the fundaments of the game in unique ways)SingleplayerCo-op (up to 4 people on a stock server)VersusRealism Co-Op (harder co-op, no glows, witches insta kill, etc.)Realism VS (versus with no glows and witches insta kill, etc.)Scavenge (play against the infected and fill up the generator, the more cans the more points)-----The only con is the players you will find, as I said above you will meet the worst of the worst. While hackers are sparse, trolls are not.BUTdont let that discourage you because I have met hundreds of people in L4D2 that I call "Friend" and I have found many communities I can call "Home"

content:
ry 23, 2015
												This game promotes highly on teamplays, assisting others as well as communicating with your fellow teammates.There are 2 roles that you can play in this game:* As a human survivor *You will spend just as much time protecting, helping and healing your teammates as the difficulty progresses. Everything from sharing resources to pulling them up off of a ledge. Leaving a teammate behind decreases your chances of survival and running off on your own almost always ends tragically. Hence, you will come to realise that it is fun sticking together and helping one another.  **As a special infected (e.g. Smoker, Boomer, Charger, Jockey, Tank, etc...) [Only in versus mode] **Similar plays are executed from a different perspective. Only when the team that plans and works together as a whole will prevent the survivors from progressing the stage and winning. Attacking alone rarely has much of an effect since you'll get focused as soon as you are spotted, but there are a few opportunities  that allows zombie heroics (like the coveted death charge).This game offers many competitive modes with different difficulty levels of your choice. It also brings teamplay to a whole new level as you challenge higher difficulty as you progress. Worth a shot if you like zombie games! Recommended.

content:
, 2015
-Quick Review-Left 4 Dead 2 (L4D2) is a zombie/horror First Person Shooter, Left 4 Dead 2 was released in 2009 by Valve. There are thirteen campaigns in Left 4 Dead 2, Six of them are from the original Left 4 Dead Series and have the original survivors/characters.-Detailed breakdown review-Story:  Left 4 Dead 2 takes place on the top of a hotel building to the site of a Helicopter flying away and the survivors cursing their luck at missing their ticket out of this town. You play as one of four survivors: Coach, Ellis, Nick, and Rochelle.Without giving away any details on what are within the campaign, the names of the campaigns in L4D2 are: Dead Center, The Passing, Dark Carnival, Swamp Fever, Hard Rain, and the Parish. +3 downloadable campaigns. Each Campaign has its own dark theme, and sometimes it's very own zombies.Summary: You've survived the zombie apocalypse, oh no! Just kidding! Now you need to fight your way through the hoards of zombies to survive the zombie apocalypse! Fight through the city, demented circus, swamps, and tall grass fields!Game Play: Left 4 Dead 2 controls like any other FPS with the addition of flashlights, and various other weapons you can swap in-game that you find on the ground. The game lets you chose between 20+ guns and 11 melee weapons. There are a number of game modes in Left 4 Dead 2: Campaign, Single Player, Survival, Versus, Realism Versus, Realism, Scavenge, and Mutation. It's difficult to try to explain general concepts behind each game mode, each one has its own quirks or game play, generally there are two types of game modes: Story related, and Player vs Player.Achievements: Left 4 Dead 2 has 70 Achievements, at the time that I'm writing this review (05/15/15) I have 40 of these achievements... most of which are related to the main campaign. The achievements are split between the campaigns and the extra game modes where you need to play against other players.Price: Left 4 Dead 2 is priced at $19.99 for most people this is a very good deal because of the games replay value, and many features, modes, and campaigns. As always, I suggest waiting for a sale, but this is one of the first steam games I ever purchased......Mostly because of the promise of a friend who'd play it with me, and then played it with me once. Thanks, feeling the love. (I don't buy the games he recommends anymore, unless I plan to play by myself. </3  )Conclusion: In my opinion, Left 4 Dead 2 is one of the best zombie games out there. Giving you a large amount of wiggle room to use your favorite weapons regardless of how good they are, different difficulties, and competitive online play if-you-so-desire.I recommend this game to FPS Junkies, regular steam gamer's, and zombie-game-fanatics.

content:
24, 2014
												Gameplay controls are easy to learn and master. Modding the game, downloading new maps, skins, or different game modes is very easy due to Steam Community Workshop. If some aspect of the game becomes dull and unintriguing, you can always find new content on the Steam Workshop.It's fun at first, but over time it starts lacking the same experience as in the beginning if you keep paying the same game modes.  The community isn't the greatest either when it comes to newer players. You automatically receive a nasty comment when you make a mistake. Game would be more fun if other players weren't as discouraging. But, not all players are bad and rude, there are some players that help you out and teach you other things that you might've not already known.I'm putting this review as recommended but my thoughts about this game are mixed and I'd recommend on some aspects but not on other ones. The biggest downside to this game, I think, is the childish Community, but if you're up for it and don't really care about that, it would be a fun game. On the otherhand, if you dislike childish Communities, don't buy this game unless you're going to play with close friends that don't mind you sucking at first or completely carrying the team depending how good you are.

content:
13, 2015
												Note: For some reason my play hours for this and the first are waaay lower than they should be.When I heard that there would be a sequel to Left 4 Dead within a year of the original my first thought was, "Can... can Valve do that? I didn't think they were allowed to do that."My second thought was, "How could they possibly make major improvements that couldn't just be new maps?" I was so wrong to ever doubt the Great and Powerful Oz that is Valve.A female zombie, very forward thinking Valve. She's called the Spitter? One step forward, two steps back.New guns? Awesome. Smash a zombie with a guitar? What guns?New characters that still follow basic stereotypes? Who cares? I don't even remember the names from the first one.They've got new maps, new playmodes, tons of new achievements, and even more replayability. I apologize for ever doubting Valve... but you've proven you can get a sequel out quick and great, soooooooooo...Yeah, never mind. I'm happy with what we've got. I'll keep bashing in skulls with this guitar.Suggestion: Pull a Guitar Hero and add the Bass Guitar into the next game and pretend it's completely different.10/10 would completely deny having startled the witch again

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 19, 2014
Cooperative FPS with Zombies! [KAMGUSTA's REVIEW]You and 3 people have to find your own way to safety by killing THOUSANDS of zombies. These can be "special", with abilities that can immobilize a player or so powerful that can defeat all 4 players by themselves, so you have to listen to every sound and keep your eyes always open. There are dozens of weapons that gets upgraded by the time, but you will soon notice that your best chance of surviving is by helping each other (and the game greatly forces you to do this)!Game is divided in "campaigns", each one can be completed in 1-2 hours and has different levels of difficulty. The single player story is nice (but don't expect speeches or cinematics: this game has only action) but the game really shines online: it still has dedicated (and populated) servers and it's very easy to join a game. You can play the official campaigns (they also remade the ones from LFD1), custom ones or some nice variations on the gameplay like humans vs zombies.Replay value is high: you will spend countless hours without noticing! And killing lot of zombies in easy mode is a great stress relief!There is really nothing more you can ask, if not another Left for Dead.Best played with Keyboard and MouseRecommended Buy Price < 30$Score 9/10

content:
r 30, 2015
												Once again Valve set the standard for game development! L4D2 is, on the surface, a simple game based upon easy to understand principles and mechanics... however it is a game of outstanding depth and complexity that takes many 1000s of hours play to master. Recomendations for new players. 1) Learn the game in easy/normal coop mode before moving on to higher levels and competitive modes. 2) Try to make friends with players who are of a similar level as yourself, there is no matchmaking in L4D2 but you will have a far more enjoyable time playing with players like yourself. 3) L4D2 is a TEAM game, if you join a random game your actions could very dramatically effect the progression of the game for the other players, a game that may have been going on for a long time before your arrival. Show respect for other players, if you just want to mess about please don't ruin other peoples games at the same time, this is not TF2 or CS casual where you can jump in and out of games without having any effect on other people playing the game. If you are a solo gamer, who always likes doing their own thing, who plays alone and doenst want to think about or worry about other players, then L4D2 is NOT RECOMMENDED FOR YOU!

content:
23, 2016
												Left 4 Dead 2 wasn't the kind of game I thought it would be. I suppose I was expecting something along the lines of Dead Island, or Dead Rising, but Left 4 Dead 2 is far from that. It is a survival game, where you rush to get through various area's, collect weapons and healing kits and more, as you fight waves of incoming, increasingly deadly zombies. Some are spitters, some are chargers, almost all of them run directly for you, full sprint, and you must push through to stay alive. Now there are several different ways to play this. I chose a single player game where I was given a team of NPC's to accompany me; However, the campaign mode is a cooperative multiplayer mode, where you play with other players online.  I'm not really a fan of cooperative or competitive multiplayer, so I'm glad Left 4 Dead 2 allowed me to play solo, but there are several other modes available, as well as addon content and more. It's not a bad game, it was actually kind of fun, although I thought it could have been more difficult on the hardest settings. over 130 of my friends have this game so obviously people like it, after playing it for a short time, I can see why.
